meanings.definition: A part of an antigen molecule to which an antibody attaches itself.
meanings.sent1: The epitopes on the virus helped the antibodies identify and attack it.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the epitopes to develop a vaccine against the disease.
meanings.sent3: The epitopes on the bacteria were like little flags waving for the antibodies to see.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against infection, epitopes act as the keys that unlock the immune response.
meanings.sent5: The epitopes were like puzzle pieces that fit perfectly with the antibodies.

meanings.definition: A small part of a protein that is recognized by the immune system.
meanings.sent1: The epitopes of the allergen triggered an allergic reaction in the body.
meanings.sent2: The immune system can detect and target specific epitopes on harmful proteins.
meanings.sent3: The epitopes were like secret codes that only the immune system could decipher.
meanings.sent4: Each epitope is like a unique marker that the immune system uses to identify intruders.
meanings.sent5: The epitopes acted as beacons, guiding the immune cells to the infected area.
